# eventAttribution | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ UIKit ](/documentation/uikit)

- [ UIApplication ](/documentation/uikit/uiapplication)

-  eventAttribution 

Type Property# eventAttribution

iOS 14.5–26.0DeprecatediPadOS 14.5–26.0DeprecatedMac Catalyst 14.5–26.0DeprecatedvisionOS 1.0–26.0Deprecated

```
static let eventAttribution: UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey
```

Deprecated

Use UIScene lifecycle and UIScene.ConnectionOptions.eventAttribution instead.

## [See Also](/documentation/UIKit/UIApplication/LaunchOptionsKey/eventAttribution#see-also)

### [Accessing launch options](/documentation/UIKit/UIApplication/LaunchOptionsKey/eventAttribution#Accessing-launch-options)

[`static let bluetoothCentrals: UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey`](/documentation/uikit/uiapplication/launchoptionskey/bluetoothcentrals)A key indicating that the app was relaunched to handle Bluetooth-related events.Deprecated[`static let bluetoothPeripherals: UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey`](/documentation/uikit/uiapplication/launchoptionskey/bluetoothperipherals)A key indicating that the app should continue actions associated with its Bluetooth peripheral objects.Deprecated[`static let cloudKitShareMetadata: UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey`](/documentation/uikit/uiapplication/launchoptionskey/cloudkitsharemetadata)A key indicating that the app received a CloudKit share invitation.Deprecated[`static let location: UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey`](/documentation/uikit/uiapplication/launchoptionskey/location)A key indicating that the app was launched to handle an incoming location event.Deprecated[`static let newsstandDownloads: UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey`](/documentation/uikit/uiapplication/launchoptionskey/newsstanddownloads)A key indicating that the app was launched to process newly downloaded Newsstand assets.Deprecated[`static let remoteNotification: UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey`](/documentation/uikit/uiapplication/launchoptionskey/remotenotification)A key indicating that a remote notification is available for the app to process.Deprecated[`static let shortcutItem: UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey`](/documentation/uikit/uiapplication/launchoptionskey/shortcutitem)A key indicating that the app was launched in response to the user selecting a Home screen quick action.Deprecated[`static let sourceApplication: UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey`](/documentation/uikit/uiapplication/launchoptionskey/sourceapplication)A key indicating that another app requested the launch of your app.Deprecated[`static let url: UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey`](/documentation/uikit/uiapplication/launchoptionskey/url)A key indicating that the app was launched so that it could open the specified URL.Deprecated[`static let userActivityDictionary: UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey`](/documentation/uikit/uiapplication/launchoptionskey/useractivitydictionary)A key indicating a dictionary associated with an activity that the user wants to continue.Deprecated[`static let userActivityType: UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey`](/documentation/uikit/uiapplication/launchoptionskey/useractivitytype)A key indicating the type of user activity that the user wants to continue.Deprecated[`static let annotation: UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey`](/documentation/uikit/uiapplication/launchoptionskey/annotation)A key indicating that the URL passed to your app contained custom annotation data from the source app.Deprecated[`static let localNotification: UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey`](/documentation/uikit/uiapplication/launchoptionskey/localnotification)A key indicating that the app was launched to handle a local notification.Deprecated
